alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 12 at 3:41AM EST until January 13 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern Connecticut, including the following areas, Hartford, Tolland and Windham Counties. Massachusetts, including the following areas, Bristol, Essex, Franklin, Hampden, Hampshire, Middlesex, Norfolk, Plymouth, Worcester and Suffolk Counties. And Rhode Island, including the following areas, Bristol, Kent, Newport, Providence and Washington Counties, except for Block Island. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A widespread additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches of rain is expected tonight into Saturday. With the ground already saturated from heavy rainfall and snowmelt earlier this week, current river and stream flooding may be exacerbated. New flooding of additional areas is also possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk
